Articles.Content:
Hi,

I stumbled across KSP a couple of months ago I believe, it looked interesting so I bookmarked it, but left it rotting in my (quite humongous) list of 'interesting bookmarks' for quite a while. Last week I revisited it again and decided to buy it. I've been basically playing it every free moment I have since.

I immediately threw myself in the career mode and quickly realized that this game is a lot more complex than it looks at first glance. Countless times I had to resort to google to find solutions to my problems, often getting referred to posts on this forum. And more than once solving a problem only created several new ones, something that seems to be common among KSP players. Like having an astronaut stranded on the mun, sending a rescuecraft to help said stranded astronaut, only to have the rescuecraft become stranded too and needing a second rescuecraft to rescue the first rescuecraft... Let me say it one more time.. rescuecraft!

Anyway, finding myself chuckling more than once at familiar stories on the forums I finally decided to join the community. Most games I play(ed) have, to be frank, ....e communities; I'm talking about battlefield, league of legends, call of duty, ... But this forum radiates a welcome, 'cosy' athmosphere and I strive to become a productive (or at the very least not counterproductive ) member of this pleasant community.

TLDR: Hi, I'm new, bye
Hello enclose, and welcome to the forum.
